meanings.definition: The quality of being petty or trivial in nature.
meanings.sent1: Her constant focus on the pettinesses of others made it hard to enjoy spending time with her.
meanings.sent2: I try to ignore the pettinesses at work and focus on the bigger picture.
meanings.sent3: The pettinesses of the argument over who left the lights on seemed silly in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent4: The pettinesses in their relationship were like tiny cracks slowly breaking the foundation.
meanings.sent5: The pettinesses of gossip can poison even the strongest friendships.

meanings.definition: Small or insignificant actions or behaviors that demonstrate a lack of maturity or generosity.
meanings.sent1: His constant pettinesses towards his classmates only pushed them further away.
meanings.sent2: Ignoring her pettinesses was challenging, but he knew it was the best way to handle the situation.
meanings.sent3: The pettinesses of arguing over who gets the last cookie seemed amusing to the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The pettinesses in their interactions were like tiny pebbles causing a big rift between them.
meanings.sent5: The pettinesses of their competition made the whole event feel like a childish game.
